title: Minimal Land for Cereal Production
description: In 2022, Antigua and Barbuda had only 5 hectares of land dedicated to cereal production, indicating limited agricultural capacity.

title: Significant Technical Cooperation Grants
description: In 2021, Antigua and Barbuda received $530,000 in technical cooperation grants, showcasing international support for development projects.

title: Negative Net Bilateral Aid from the US
description: In 2021, the net bilateral aid flows from the United States to Antigua and Barbuda were negative, amounting to approximately -$40,000.

title: Minimal Net Official Flows from WHO
description: Antigua and Barbuda received $3,200 in net official flows from WHO in 2021, indicating limited financial support from this UN agency.

title: Low Methane Emissions from Buildings
description: In 2023, methane emissions from buildings in Antigua and Barbuda were extremely low at 0.0001 Mt CO2e, reflecting minimal environmental impact from this sector.

title: Minimal Freshwater Withdrawals
description: In 2021, Antigua and Barbuda's total annual freshwater withdrawals were only 0.0044 billion cubic meters, indicating efficient water use or limited water resources.

title: Low Industrial Design Applications
description: With only 1 industrial design application filed by residents in 2021, Antigua and Barbuda shows limited innovation in industrial design.

title: Small Armed Forces Personnel
description: In 2016, Antigua and Barbuda had a total of 180 armed forces personnel, reflecting a small military presence.

title: Low Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Upper Secondary
description: In 2015, the pupil-teacher ratio in upper secondary education was 3.71, suggesting a favorable learning environment with more personalized attention.

title: Minimal Child Mortality Ages 5-9
description: In 2023, there was only 1 recorded death in the age group of 5-9 years, indicating strong child health and safety measures.
